Thank you for your feedback about JUnit 4. My responses are below.

Kent Beck
Three Rivers Institute

> -----Original Message-----
> From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On 
> Behalf Of mherrmann_at
> Sent: Tuesday, November 01, 2005 8:00 AM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [junit] Re: JUnit 4 restructuring
> 
> And why
> 1) does junit.framework.Assert still define assertEquals for
> boolean, int, long etc. (autoboxing could do that; in fact, deleting
> those methods doesn't produce any errors)?

Inertia. We'll fix this.

> 2) isn't java.lang.AssertionError used instead of
> junit.framework.AssertionFailedError?

java.lang.AssertionError is used in org.junit.Assert. Here is the code
freshly copied from JUnit 4:
	static public void fail(String message) {
		throw new AssertionError(message);
	}

For backward compatibility, junit.framework.AssertionFailedError is still
used in junit.framework.Assert.
